newsitem.title: UK: Father says Kenya safari killers tracked down.
newsitem.headline: Father says Kenya safari killers tracked down.

text.p: After a nine-year search for his daughter's killers, John Ward is convinced Kenyan police have found the men who murdered "safari girl" Julie Ward.
"I am totally convinced that these two men killed my daughter," Ward told the Sunday Times after the arrest of a police officer and a ranger.

Ward said both will be named in a police report which will recommend that they are charged with her murder. Both deny killing Julie Ward, 28, in the Masai Mara Game Reserve where she had been studying wildlife.
"Last week I was sitting just a few feet away from one of them and it was a strange sensation after all this time," Ward said after flying back from Nairobi.
He has spent the past three months working with a small team of Kenyan police reinvestigating the murder.
The two suspects were questioned for two weeks. Both have since been released.
Ward said: "I now want the men who murdered my daughter tried and convicted. That is what it has all been about for nine years, nothing more, nothing less."
